summary: This document consists of multiple 30-minute inmate check sheets from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit for August 9, 2019. The sheets record staff observations of inmates in locked-down status, following a protocol requiring checks at least twice per hour. The document is significant as it provides a record of the prison's monitoring procedures on the day Jeffrey Epstein died in custody.

events.title: Inmate Monitoring at MCC New York
events.description: Staff at the MCC New York Special Housing Unit conducted 30-minute checks on inmates in locked-down status throughout the day and night, documenting each observation as per protocol.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Special Housing Unit
keyFacts: The document is a set of prison check sheets dated August 9, 2019, the day Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell.
It details a strict protocol requiring staff to observe inmates in locked-down status at least twice per hour on an irregular schedule.
The sheets are from multiple tiers (L, M, ZA, ZB) within the Special Housing Unit, indicating checks were conducted across different sections.
Each sheet was reviewed by a Morning Watch Lieutenant and a Captain, showing a chain of oversight.
The document itself is a routine administrative record but gains significance due to its date and location in the context of Epstein's death.
